channel.title: Problem
channel.description:
Not sure what to call this problem, but I am using an Allstar source and I have found a little problem that is annoying.
when I try to mute or ban a player, if the player is online and just barely logged in it sais the player is not online. but if I log out and log back in and try it, it works. so it doesn't realize that the player is online if i'm online before that player.
sorry for not explaining very well but does anybody know what might be the problem and what I could do to fix it?

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

You said your server tells you “that player is not online”. Well in the two methods you posted it does not say anything about if the player is not online. search for the “not online” portion, see where the real issue is.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @ReaperXScape ReaperXScape
item.description:
@ReaperXScape wrote:

no compiler errors. it just does the same thing ingame when I try.

Read full topic

doesn’t work. and I compiled too

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

[quote=“lare69, post:12, topic:542850”][quote author=ReaperXScape link=topic=661724.msg4423390#msg4423390 date=1399509397]
bruh you is trying to scam my codes. but here you go!

public static int getPlayerID(String playerName) {
        for (int i = 0; i < maxPlayers; i++) {
            if (playersCurrentlyOn[i] != null) {
                if (playersCurrentlyOn[i].equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) {
                    return i;
                }
            }
        }
        return -1;
    }

[/quote]

public static int getPlayerID(String playerName) {
        for (int i = 0; i < players.length; i++) {
            if (players[i] != null) {
                if (players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) {
                    return i;
                }
            }
        }
        return -1;
    }

try that[/quote]

That’s the ticket.

Read full topic

@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“ReaperXScape, post:11, topic:542850”]bruh you is trying to scam my codes. but here you go!

public static int getPlayerID(String playerName) { for (int i = 0; i < maxPlayers; i++) { if (playersCurrentlyOn[i] != null) { if (playersCurrentlyOn[i].equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) { return i; } } } return -1; } [/quote]

public static int getPlayerID(String playerName) {
        for (int i = 0; i < players.length; i++) {
            if (players[i] != null) {
                if (players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerName)) {
                    return i;
                }
            }
        }
        return -1;
    }

try that

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @ReaperXScape ReaperXScape
item.description:
@ReaperXScape wrote:

ok. here is the command.

if (command.startsWith("mute") && playerRights >= 1 && playerRights <= 3) {
String name = command.substring(5);
client c = (client) PlayerHandler.players[PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(name)];
c.muted = 1;
sendMessage("You Mute "+c.playerName+"");
c.sendMessage("You Have Been Muted By : "+playerName+"");
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = ""+c.playerName+" Has Been Muted By : "+playerName+"";
}

Read full topic

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

Post the entire mute/ban command, not just the loop (it probably is the command, not the server.)

Read full topic

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @ReaperXScape ReaperXScape
item.description:
@ReaperXScape wrote:

was replying to tatemo. and it’s not the commands that are the problem, its that the server is not recognizing that the player is online.
ill make an example…

player1 broke a rule and is going to be muted the next time he is online.
player2 (admin) is online, and then player1 logs in.
player2 types the command to mute the player and it sais the player is not online, when he actually is.
player2 logs out and back in and since player1 was already online when player2 logged in, it works this time.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“ReaperXScape, post:5, topic:542850”]for (int i = 0; i < maxPlayerListSize; i++) {

I think that’s the code u were talking about, I found that in player.java

so I changed it to this :
for (int i = 0; i < maxPlayerListSize + 1; i++) {

Edit : Tried it doesn’t work, doesn’t let me log in.[/quote]
what…? no, the code that you’re using to mute/ban the player…

Read full topic

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @ReaperXScape ReaperXScape
item.description:
@ReaperXScape wrote:

for (int i = 0; i < maxPlayerListSize; i++) {

I think that’s the code u were talking about, I found that in player.java

so I changed it to this :
for (int i = 0; i < maxPlayerListSize + 1; i++) {

Edit : Tried it doesn’t work, doesn’t let me log in.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

Sounds like your player loop is stopping 1 index before the last index in the player loop.

In the command there were be a piece of code that resembles this for(int i = 0; i < player count; i++) (Maybe not exactly) try adding appending +1 to the player count bit (only add “+1” before the ‘;’ don’t change any of the existing code.)

Read full topic

item.description:

lare69:

post the command or whatever code you’re using to punish the player

That’d definitely help. If anything try to simple it out more, like what do you mean by barely online? it’s probably an easy fix
